articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Current US Domestic News Highlights
articles.description: This summary provides an overview of key US domestic news: RFK Jr. ends his presidential campaign to endorse Trump, legal updates on the Breonna Taylor case, Texas challenges Biden's new immigration program, Steve Bannon faces a criminal trial, FBI investigates an attack on a Sikh separatist, a Memphis officer pleads guilty in Tyre Nichols' death, and other notable headlines.
articles.content:

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Iranian Hackers Target WhatsApp Accounts in U.S. Political Interference Effort
articles.description: An Iranian hacking group targeted WhatsApp accounts of staffers in Biden and Trump administrations, posing as tech support from companies like Microsoft and Google, Meta Platforms revealed. This cyberattack was part of broader Iranian efforts to interfere with U.S. elections, polarize voters, and oppose candidates unfavorable to Iran.
articles.content:
Meta Platforms revealed that an Iranian hacking group, previously linked to targeting both Democratic and Republican campaigns, attempted to breach the WhatsApp accounts of staffers in the Biden and Trump administrations.
The group posed as tech supp... [459 chars]

articles.title: Foo Fighters say Donald Trump did not have permission to use My Hero at rally
articles.description: The US rockers’ hit song was played at an Arizona election campaign event on Friday.
articles.content:
Foo Fighters are the latest artists to have had their music used by Donald Trump for his presidential election campaign without their permission.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Steve Bannon to Stand Trial Over 'We Build the Wall' Fraud Allegations
articles.description: Former Trump advisor Steve Bannon must face a trial in New York for criminal-fraud charges related to the 'We Build the Wall' fundraising campaign. A judge rejected his motion to dismiss the charges, and the trial is set for Dec. 9. Bannon, currently in federal prison for defying a congressional subpoena, pleaded not guilty.
articles.content: Former Donald Trump advisor Steve Bannon will face trial in New York on criminal-fraud charges related to the 'We Build the Wall' fundraising campaign, Judge Justice April Newbauer ruled on Friday. This decision denies Bannon's motion to dismiss the ... [1057 chars]

articles.title: Trump will soon be free to tank his own stock
articles.description: Trump owns about 59% of Trump Media, which is the parent company of his social media platform, Truth Social.
articles.content:
Donald Trump will soon be free to start selling off more than $2 billion in shares he holds in the company that controls his social media platform, Truth Social—but doing so could send the stock price plummeting.

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: Kamala Harris wants to break through the 'hardest glass ceiling' to defeat Trump. Democrats know it won't be easy
articles.description: Harris doesn't have time to mess around. Biden's last-minute withdrawal from the race has left her with a very limited window to sell herself to undecided voters. It also leaves less time to rebound from any stumbles.
articles.content:

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump Proposes Tax-Free Tips in Las Vegas Amid Harris' Campaign Surge
articles.description: Donald Trump announced plans to eliminate taxes on tips during a Las Vegas stop, attempting to shift focus from personal attacks on opponent Kamala Harris. His new policy aims to appeal to Hispanic voters in Nevada. Despite this, Harris continues to gain attention and leads in key battleground states.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Suspends Presidential Campaign, Endorses Trump
articles.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. halted his independent presidential bid and endorsed Donald Trump, citing internal polls showing his campaign could harm Trump and benefit Democratic nominee Kamala Harris. Kennedy's move, driven by issues like free speech and the Ukraine war, has caused tension within his famed political family.
articles.content: In a significant political turn, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has suspended his independent campaign for president and endorsed former President Donald Trump. Kennedy stated that his internal polls suggested his presence in the race could hurt Trump and hel... [563 chars]

articles.description: Robert F Kennedy, nephew of assassinated former president JFK Kennedy and the son of Bobby Kennedy, who was killed while running for the White House, has thrown his support behind Republican nominee Donald Trump.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Meta Uncovers Iranian Hackers' Attempts to Breach WhatsApp Accounts of U.S. Officials
articles.description: Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has identified attempts by an Iranian hacker group, APT42, to breach WhatsApp accounts of U.S. officials from the Biden and Trump administrations. The hackers posed as technical support and targeted political, diplomatic, and business figures across several countries.
articles.content: Meta reported identifying hacking attempts on WhatsApp accounts of U.S. officials from both Biden and Trump administrations by an Iranian hacker group APT42. The attempts, discovered in a 'small cluster of likely social engineering activity,' involve... [779 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Ends Campaign, Endorses Donald Trump
articles.description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. ended his campaign and endorsed Donald Trump. Despite initially challenging Biden as a Democrat, Kennedy switched to an independent run. His support dipped following rapid political changes, leading him to endorse Trump, hoping for potential roles in a Trump administration.
articles.content: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. abandoned his campaign on Friday and endorsed Republican Donald Trump, ending a presidential bid that he began as a Democrat trading on one of the most famous names in American politics. Strate... [781 chars]
